eventName: A Song and a Blue Feather
storyName: A Song and a Blue Feather
storyInfo: In a remote Leithanian village, a sickly boy regains hope thanks to the help he receives from Nightingale and Nearl. But providing treatment pushes Nightingale's body to its limits.

attributes.content: 4:37 P.M. \ Clear
A certain village in northern Leithanien
*cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Feeble Child

attributes.content: Oh, what should we do? Luca is in so much pain!
attributes.name: Anxious Mother

attributes.content: Mama, it hurts... It hurts... My leg... My leg feels like it's on fire.
attributes.name: Feeble Child

attributes.content: Shh, Luca. Bear with it, and keep your voice down. Thomas next door will hear you.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: You're a strong boy. One of the strongest there is! If you can't bear it, just bite the pillow.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: He's almost chewed the cotton down to shreds! Look at how much he's sweating! He has a fever, too. We... we should take him to Dr. Marcos!
attributes.name: Anxious Mother

attributes.content: No, we can't!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Look. Look at his leg... This black lump.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: It's Oripathy...
attributes.name: Anxious Mother

attributes.content: Shh, don't say it out loud. We need to keep this from Luca.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: You know what happened to Ben over at the Janiks. His arms had these lumps, and they took him away. His family hasn't seen him since.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: *sob*... Luca... Don't let them take my Luca.
attributes.name: Anxious Mother

attributes.content: This is how it is... We have to... endure and ride it out.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Mama... Mamaaa...
attributes.name: Feeble Child

attributes.content: Here, bite Papa's hand, Luca. Hang in there... You're a big boy. You'll get better.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: A miracle will happen... A miracle will heal you up.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: We need to have faith.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Hello, is anybody home?
Someone's knocking on our door! They must be here to take Luca away!
attributes.name: Anxious Mother

attributes.content: Calm down. I'll take a look through the window. You and Luca stay in here. Don't come out.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Hello, sir.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: A Kuranta? Dressed up like a knight too. Not something we see in our small village every day.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Sir, please relax. We're just a few wandering doctors passing through. If it's not too much to ask, could you bring us some water?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Water... Right, okay... If you're willing to drink the water here, I won't turn you away.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Here, you go. Leave as soon as you are finished. Take the cup with you.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: What's wrong, Liz? The water seems fine to me.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: I can feel it... That silent, voiceless pain... It's right here.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Right. It's weak, but still clear as day.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Someone's screaming for help.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: If that's what you two say—
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Sir... Does someone in your family have Oripathy?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Oripathy?! H-How dare you!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: He's in pain, isn't he? But he hasn't given up hope.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I can... heal him.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You... Those horns... That shape! You, and you! You are devils!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Mister, please calm down. Just as I mentioned, we are doctors. If anyone is infected with Oripathy here, we can help alleviate their symptoms, and you don't need to give us anything in return.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: I told you—No one's sick here, and we definitely don't need any treatment!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Now leave, Kuranta! You're full of lies! And you, devils, stay far away from my house!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Looks like he made his decision. He doesn't want us to treat his family.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: It happens fairly often.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Normally, a doctor needs to earn her patient's trust, and he doesn't trust us.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: He seems nervous. It might be our race or status that's agitated him.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: If Nearl has to wave the white flag, famous and popular as she is, then Liz and I don't stand a chance. Sarkaz don't have a good reputation here.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We could try persuading him. We've done that many times before.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: We can, as long as we don't end up coming across any Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Right. It's much easier to convince a patient's family than an entire squad of Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: We need to avoid that kind of 'persuasion.'
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yeah, Liz hasn't been doing very well lately... I agree. We shouldn't take any risks.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Unfortunately, if this drags on much longer, the patient's condition will deteriorate.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Feels bad...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz, are you okay? Are you feeling sick?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: That boy... He's having a really bad time... He's locked in that small room while his Oripathy torments him.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz is right. The kid is locked away. They're even stifling his screams.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Are they torturing an Infected?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: No, not at all. The father... He didn't show any hatred on his face when he mentioned Oripathy.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: There is hatred everywhere else.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Is he protecting the patient, then?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: I heard the Leithanians take the Infected away from their families, round them up to live in ghettoes.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: If the patient is his child, I suppose he might be trying to hide his Infection, to keep the Gendarmerie from taking his boy away.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: He may care for his child, but that's slowly taking his child's life.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: He is losing his chance to live, and his energy is slowly draining away in this cage of love.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz!
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Don't think about that... It'll only worsen your condition if you let that sadness get to you.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We've walked a very long distance today. I can tell you are exhausted. You need rest.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Does it feel better when you lean against me? The tent will be ready soon.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Let's start a fire and get you something to eat.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: It's getting dark. The Leithanian Gendarmerie moves quickly, and they might be here by tomorrow. We should leave this place before do, if we want to stay out of trouble.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Right, it's not a good idea to show ourselves to the Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Liz, lie down here, closer to the fire. It'll warm you up.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You two should get some rest. I'll stand watch.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: It's the Gendarmerie. They're here.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining, are you awake already? You went to bed not that long ago.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: I got enough sleep. We need to leave right now. Liz, can you walk?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yeah, I can.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Ughh...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You look really pale. Did you get enough rest?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I... I'm okay. I just feel a little dizzy.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: The Gendarmerie went straight to the house we visited last night. Shining, should we really just leave like this?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: There's a good hiding spot behind the bushes.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: They won't spot us there.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Nearl, hold Liz. If it looks like things are getting out of hand, do as you see fit.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Mr. Reiss! Please open the door!
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Mr. Reiss!
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Officer, look! I told you something's not right with Old Reiss's family!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: His boy—his name is Luca—he was playing in the fields a few days ago, and he suddenly got sick after he came back.
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: For the few days after that, his family kept themselves locked inside, and they wouldn't come out, no matter what!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: I-I'm just taking care of Luca...
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: How am I supposed to believe you?! What kind of disease would keep a strong kid like him bedridden for days on end?
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: Besides, if your kid really caught a cold, you could've taken him to Dr. Marcos!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: Something sounds fishy here.
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Right, officer? I am doing this for everyone's safety!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: This is a peaceful, quiet village. We can't let Oripathy ruin our lives here!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: Right, all Infected must be quarantined at a nearby quarantine zone.
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Right? Reiss, did you hear that? Your boy's just going to the quarantine zone! Luca will be in good hands there! Much better than keeping him here!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: But what, Mr. Reiss? You will need to open this door today.
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Yeah, Papa, open the door.
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: I'm starving. I want bread. And not just one slice. I can eat five or six slices in one go.
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Huh—Huh?!
attributes.name: Nervous Neighbor

attributes.content: Oh, Uncle Thomas. Sorry for bumping into you. I'm in a rush to get home for breakfast so Mama doesn't give me a scolding.
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Oh, Luca, you're home at last. What took you so long?
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: I'm very sorry, Officer. This is my boy, Luca. It's not that I didn't want to open up. He really wasn't home.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: This boy is Luca? He looks as fit as a fiddle. Is he really sick?
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: *cough*, just a little cold. You know boys his age. They get sick after a day of fun and games.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: I suppose so. I've met plenty of Infected. None of them are nearly as lively. Dr. Marcos, what do you think?
attributes.name: Leithanian Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Oh... Oh? You want me to check him? Let me take a look.
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: Look at how muscular and sweaty his arms are. So sturdy to the feel.
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: And his legs...
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: *Cough*
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: My, what strong legs. There's so much mud. Looks like this boy has been having fun.
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: Sorry for all the trouble, Dr. Marcos.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Oh, no need to worry! Officer, we've been working all morning. I'm as famished as one can be, My vision is starting to blur.
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: Perhaps we should let the boy go home for his breakfast?
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: Don't worry, if little Luca gets sick again, I will check on him, and if anything's amiss, I will let you know right away.
attributes.name: Elderly Doctor

attributes.content: Phew... Thank goodness.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Luca, my boy! Let Papa look at you!
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: You're... fine? You can run all over the place, and you can eat...
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: These crystals... They are still here, but they're much smaller now. Not nearly as swollen anymore. You've gotten much better. No wonder Dr. Marcos didn't notice.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: I-Is this a miracle?
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Papa, it isn't a miracle. A fowlbeast healed me!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: A fowlbeast...?
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: It was a really, really pretty fowlbeast! Its feathers were so much bluer than the water in the lake! I've never seen a little fowlbeast so beautiful!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Last night, it flew into my room through the window, and settled by my pillow.
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: There was a white light around the tiny fowlbeast. It was so bright and warm...
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: It came over me, and I stopped hurting right away.
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: A small fowlbeast? And one that glowed?
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Yeah! I'm not lying!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: My boy, you were ill. You were probably hallucinating.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: It wasn't! It sang a song too! I heard it! The blue fowlbeast sang a song for me!
attributes.name: Lively Child

attributes.content: Okay, okay. Everything's fine now. It's all okay...
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: Thank you, blue, magical fowlbeast. I have no idea if you were real or not—you definitely weren't—but whichever the case, thank you for giving Luca a pleasant dream.
attributes.name: Helpless Father

attributes.content: We should get going.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: You aren't mad, are you...?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Why would I be mad about a little blue bird checking on a sickly boy at night?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Oh, right, the bird was glowing in the dark, too.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Sorry, Shining, Liz just couldn't fall asleep last night, so I...
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Shining, I was the one who asked Nearl to help me treat the boy.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I couldn't fall asleep otherwise... I could hear the boy's pained cries in my head.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: If it wasn't for my legs... if they had some strength left in them... I would've gone myself.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Please don't blame Nearl.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You don't have to apologize. We are doctors. You two did what you should've done.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I didn't expect the Gendarmerie to show up today, though... I wonder what will happen to the boy and his family in the future.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: They may get to live out the rest of their lives in peace, or they might have to move in the not-so-distant future.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: As doctors, we may be able to treat our patients' pain, but we don't have any way to treat their predicaments.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I know that, Shining, but I couldn't spend so much time thinking about it.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: The boy... was really hurting all over.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: When I looked at him, I felt the same pain myself.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: All I knew how to do was... help him hurt less.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I wanted to help him... to ease his pain... I wanted to help him leave that room... to help him run and jump again.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz, I just have one question. Look at me and answer me. Do you think this is really necessary?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What do you mean... necessary?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Just like what happened before.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What happened before... No, I don't want to be like before.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: At the time, they were coming for me. I was locked... I had nowhere to go. I had to heal them.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: But what about now?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Now... I'm going everywhere to find them.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I can feel the pain of those who are sick and hurt, and I don't want them hurt anymore.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I stretch my hands out to them... to embrace their pain. I have my birdie sing in their ears.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I never expected the boy would see my birdie. He seemed so happy in his sleep.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: When that happened, those shards that tied me down were gone... Birdie's steps became much lighter too.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Is that what it means to be happy? Shining, it sounds like I'm happy too.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Okay... That's the answer I wanted.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yes, Liz. That's what it means to be happy. You know what it means to be happy now.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Really? So this is how it's like to be happy. So now I... Mmm...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Does it make your heart ache?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yes, Shining... It really makes my heart ache.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Why is this happening to Liz? She doesn't have the strength to stand up.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: This is the outcome of her choice.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Because she treated the kid last night...?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Yes, her condition was hardly optimal to begin with. Even the use of simple healing Arts takes its toll on her. Not to mention she was treating acute Oripathy. She's nearing her limits.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: If I knew this was going to happen...
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: If you knew, would you have stopped her?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: This is what I wanted to do... I wanted to heal the boy.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: See? This is what Liz wanted, even though it left her exhausted.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Right... I guess I wouldn't have been able to stop her.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Exactly. This is a choice, and these are the choices you two have made. Like Liz, you always choose to sacrifice yourself to treat someone else's pain, whether visible or not.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I should've... respected your decisions.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: But my hope is that... Liz will have more choices available to her.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: And you too, Margaret. My hope is that you will have more choices too.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: What does it mean to have more choices?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: You've always wanted to see the world outside, don't you, Liz?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yes, that's my greatest wish, Shining. I've been to so many places with you and Nearl.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: These places are beautiful... Hatred and pain sometimes engulf these skies and lands, but that doesn't change the beauty that lies underneath.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: I... I still want to see much more, and not just what the bird sings to me.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Yes, it's time we expand our horizons.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: It sounds like you just made a decision, Shining.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Nearl, do you remember the pharmaceutical company that the patient we treated last time mentioned?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: You mean... Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: Yes, Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We've been wandering the world all these years. How many patients have we treated altogether?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I don't remember...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: It's okay if you don't remember, but, Liz, do you want to treat even more people out there?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Yes... I want to.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Okay. What about you, Nearl?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Rhodes Island, is it...? No objections here.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: I trust you, and I trust your decision. If that's where Liz wants to go, then we'll take her there.
attributes.name: Nearl

attributes.content: We'll be together...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Together.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We've made our decision. Let's go, then.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Let's go...
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: ...to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Nightingale
